meanings.definition: fraying: the act of unraveling or becoming worn at the edges
meanings.sent1: The frayings on the old rug showed how much it had been used.
meanings.sent2: She trimmed the frayings on the tablecloth to make it look neat again.
meanings.sent3: The frayings on the sweater made it look like a fashionable distressed piece.
meanings.sent4: The frayings on the map's edges symbolized the many adventures it had been on.
meanings.sent5: The frayings on the book's pages hinted at the countless times it had been read.

meanings.definition: fraying: threads that have become loose or unraveled from a fabric
meanings.sent1: The tailor carefully sewed up the frayings on the hem of the dress.
meanings.sent2: The frayings on the blanket made it feel rough against the skin.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the frayings on her scarf gave it a unique fringe look.
meanings.sent4: The frayings on the rope were like tiny rebellious strands trying to escape.
meanings.sent5: The frayings on the flag fluttered in the wind, adding character to its appearance.
